comment: She is one of the most helpful teacher i ever had. When u ask questions she puts in lot of effort to answer your questions and helps you more and above than you expected. Her resources are amazing, which i believe she made it herself so very inspirational. People who gave 1stars are just people who were super lazy.

Very bad teacher. I took her online asynchronous and her lectures were uploaded to youtube and were unbearable to watch. She gave 3 or 4 homeworks which weren't too bad, but her tests were pretty hard. The questions required lots of memorization of pseudocode. She also assigns a 15 page project writeup. I would steer clear if possible.

Absolutely terrible, doesnt provide feedback on assignments and practically wasnt even doing anything for the course. Left in the latter half of the semester with best instructions left to the professor that picked up her class who gave instruction haphazardly. Pick anyone else for data structures, not her for sure (if she even comes back to KSU).

The worst professor I have ever had in my entire life. When students don't understand something, she gets frustrated quickly. She does not speak English fluently so there's another obstacle for you. She is very strict with her rules and is not willing to work with you.

Terrible professor, quite honestly one of the most difficult graders I have ever had. Makes assignments out of the textbook and gives vague direction paired with awful grammar (hasn't picked up on english fully) which translates awfully for an online class. Pick another option if your going with data structures.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She's a very dry, boring lecturer. Data structures is a VERY difficult class no matter who you take regardless, but she really isn't the "best" option. She is helpful and fair with the test/quizzes (don't know how much COVID affected the difficulties) but a pretty average professor.
She's one of those professors that makes you feel stupid for asking questions. She is terrible at teaching. Most students just study the material given and teach themselves.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Took her for Algorithm Analysis online because of Covid. Shes clearly not used to online classes, lectures were incomprehensible. Basically just had to teach myself from the book. She made a semester long group project; none of the other professors have a project for AA AFAIK. Online tests required lockdown browser and a webcam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Her lectures are really good. Study the powerpoints. Take notes too.
She is so helpful. She grades everything on time. She also answers questions really well. Make sure to go to class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Her class is well-structured. She puts great efforts into her powerpoints and lectures. Listen to her lecture and study the power points. You will be fine. She answered many of my questions. She is also always available during her office hours.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a really good professor. She teaches very well. Her powerpoints are really good and elaborate. I had her during the COVID-19 lockdown. She gave us good voiceover power points which were really wonderful. However, You need to attend her class and do the work she gives. If you do that, don't worry you will do just fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: New professor here at KSU, class is very difficult. Concepts covered in class rarely appeared on tests. Few grades mean that mistakes are hard to recover from. Tests were incredibly long to the point of 3 finishing out of a class of 50-60 in the allotted time. Questions are rarely answered, and assignments might as well be written in Hieroglyphics.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Stay away, she is awful at teaching. All her assignments and tests are extraordinarily vague and it's difficult to understand what exactly she wants. Her accent is rather heavy too.
